intro: Mosiera calycolpoides subsp. calycolpoides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved mosiera, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as along stream banks or in forest understories. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hairy seeds. This subspecies is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including Malaysia and Indonesia.
